newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Riksbank sets repo rate at unchanged 4.10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Riksbank sets repo rate at unchanged 4.10 pct.

text.p: Sweden's central bank, the Riksbank, on Tuesday set a straight one week repo rate at a fixed, unchanged 4.10 percent.
The reverse repurchase operation runs from April 16 to April 23.
The bank said bids were to be received by 0800 GMT on April 15 with the lowest accepted volume 200 million crowns and the highest accepted volume 15 billion crowns.
The market had not expected the Riksbank to change the repo rate, according to Reuter poll of economists.
The repo rate was lowered 25 times in 1996, from a starting level of 8.91 percent to the current rate of 4.10 percent. It was last lowered on December 17.
The Riksbank's two other key rates, the deposit and lending rates, currently stand at 3.75 percent and 5.25 percent respectively.
